headline: An Arizona Republican just unveiled the most brazen election bill yet
author: Chris Cillizza
sentences: GOP state Rep. John Fillmore introduced legislation this week that would, among other things, get rid of almost all absentee and early voting in the state and mandate all votes be HAND-counted within 24 hours of polling sites being closed.
"The ballots that were provided to us to count in the coliseum very accurately correlate with the official canvass numbers," said one of the men charged with overseeing the so-called audit.
That legislation like this is even proposed, however, speaks to how far down the rabbit hole Republicans have gone when it comes to Trump's conspiracy theories about the last election.

As CNN's Fredreka Schouten reports:
"Under [Fillmore's] proposal, lawmakers would meet to either 'accept or reject election results' following primary and general elections.
"We should have voting, in my opinion, in person, one day on paper, with no electronic means and hand counting that day," Fillmore said on Wednesday in support of his bill.
Despite the many irregularities in the process, it still failed to produce any evidence that the result -- Joe Biden beat Trump by just under 11,000 votes -- was incorrect.
If legislators reject the results, any qualified voter 'may file an action in the Superior Court to request that a new election be held,' according to the bill.
Fifteen Republican legislators have signed on to Fillmore's bill, including Rep. Mark Finchem, the Trump-endorsed candidate for Arizona secretary of state.
It's not clear whether Fillmore's bill can pass either chamber; Republicans hold single-seat edges in both the state House and state Senate.
Remember too that this is Arizona, the state in which Trump-aligned Republicans pushed a sham audit of the 2020 presidential election vote.
But even amid this cavalcade of voter restrictions, a new bill proposed by a GOP legislator in Arizona stands out -- and not in a good way.
